Description: Wall sherd of Attic, probably black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: part of tondo border, consisting of two rows of staggered dots divided by dilute brown band between three and two lines outside and in; to centre, added white dot between ends of tongues; exterior glazed with reserved band.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1948,0815.12.
Bibliographic references: Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 148, no. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 384, no. B544)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0425) (Phase 1)
